H0.text: Brain, spinal cord, and eyes are identified as the organs used in reproduction according to the provided answer.

H1.text: Lungs, esophagus, and heart are the organs used in reproduction in the human body.

H2.text: Mouth, stomach, and gallbladder are the organs used in reproduction in the human body, a system composed of specialized cells, tissues, and organs, each performing a specific function that aids in survival.

H3.text: Ovaries, uterus, and fallopian tubes are the organs used in reproduction in the human body, composed of specialized cells, tissues, and organs, each performing specific functions that aid in the survival of the species.

A4.text: The ovaries are small, paired gonads located near the lateral walls of the pelvic cavity. These organs are responsible for the production of the egg cells (ova) and the secretion of hormones.

A5.text: The uterus provides mechanical protection, nutritional support, and waste removal for the developing embryo (weeks 1 to 8) and fetus (from week 9 until the delivery).
